page.title: 18WARMINSTER'S STAR NEWSAGENT
page.content: Housed in a 17th century building at the centre of the Market Place is one of the most successful newsagents in the West of England - "Paynes", open 96 hours a week, employing dozens of part-time staff and selling over 3000 newspapers a day. The owner, Mr Alan Gallagher, is remarkable for the wide variety of stock which he carries, so much so that he now runs 4 seemingly separate enterprises. For example, toys were once sold in the basement of Paynes; demand for toys increased so he opened a separate toy shop, Pleasures, which has now moved to even larger premises. Above the main sales floor of Paynes is his stylish and profitable tea-shop, Pollys, and along the street is his ladies' wear shop, Delights. Mr Gallagher believes that newsagents will continue to prosper because of the variety they offer.
